I respectfully disagree with your translation. I believe a more accurate English translation of the Chinese text "销售便宜的劣质产品" would be "Selling cheap, low-quality products." 

In this translation, the term "销售" is accurately translated as "selling," indicating an ongoing action rather than a general statement. By including a comma after "cheap," the translation emphasizes that the products are both cheap and of low quality, as opposed to solely focusing on the cheap aspect. Additionally, the use of a hyphen in "low-quality" helps to connect the two adjectives and convey that the products are both cheap and inferior in nature. 

Therefore, I believe that "Selling cheap, low-quality products" provides a more precise and nuanced translation of the original Chinese text.
